p: Adult male fish were used in both neurotransmitter and neurosteroid analyses. Zebrafish embryos were obtained from natural mating, and healthy embryos were incubated in embryo medium refreshed daily until 5 days post-fertilization (dpf) at 28 °C. Only 5 dpf zebrafish larvae were used for survival and ROS assays. As it was previously reported that GM-90432 reached steady-state after 1 h exposure [ 24], both larval and adult zebrafish were separated into 4 different treatment groups ( Figure 1): Group 1 (G1, control group) fish were exposed to DMSO at a similar concentration as test compounds; Group 2 (G2, GM-90432 group) fish were exposed to GM-90432 (10 µM for larvae, or 2 µM for adult zebrafish); Group 3 (G3, PTZ-induced epilepsy model group) fish were exposed to PTZ (5 mM for larvae, or 1 mM for adult zebrafish); and Group 4 (G4, GM-90432+PTZ group) fish were exposed to PTZ following 1 h GM-90432 pretreatment. The experiments were conducted in 24 well plates (for larval fish) or 1 L tanks (for adult zebrafish), respectively.
